Class ClassRoll

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClassRoll

  • public class ClassRoll
extends java.lang.Object
    Maintains student information (arbitrary number of students)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClassRoll(java.lang.String f)
      ClassRoll constructor that reads the input file, adds the students to the array list, and formats the file correctly

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add()
      Adds a student to the class roll.
      void changeScore1()
      Method to change the first score of a student
      void changeScore2()
      Changes the second score of a student.
      void changeScore3()
      Changes the third score of a student.
      void display()
      Displays the class roll from the getDisplayMessage method
      void find()
      Prompts for a student's first and last name and displays their exam scores with an average
      java.lang.String getDisplayMessage()
      A method that displays all of the class data correctly (with the scores of each student, their averages and the class average)
      void remove()
      Removes a student from the file
      void save()
      Saves the file to the same data input file.
      void sortAverage()
      Sorts the students by their averages.
      void sortNames()
      Sorts the students by their last names.

        A method that displays all of the class data correctly (with the scores of each student, their averages and the class average)

        the class average

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the class roll from the getDisplayMessage method

      • add

        public void add()
        Adds a student to the class roll. Uses a similar structure to the remove method, except it adds the student to the array instead of removing them

      • changeScore1

        public void changeScore1()
        Method to change the first score of a student

        public void sortNames()

        Saves the file to the same data input file.
